message.name: AUTOPILOT_VERSION
message.field: version encoded as: MAJOR * 10000 + MINOR * 100 + PATCH
version description as string from paparazzi_version

message.name: ALIVE
message.description: alive/heartbeat message containing the MD5sum of the aircraft configuration

message.name: PONG
message.description: Answer to PING datalink message, to measure latencies

message.name: GPS
message.field: norm of 2d ground speed in cm/s

message.name: DATALINK_REPORT
message.description: Datalink status reported by an aircraft for the ground

message.name: WP_MOVED
message.description: Waypoint with id wp_id has been updated/moved to the specified UTM coordinates.

message.name: DRAGSPEED
message.description: Velocities in body axes (assuming small pitch/roll angles) as measured by the dragspeed module and by the INS.

message.name: DCF
message.description: Telemetry message for monitoring the status of the Distributed Circular Formation.
message.field: The size of the array is 4 x (maximum number of possible neighbors). The elements per each neighbor are: 1. ID of the neighbor, 2. Theta of the neighbor (degrees x 100), 3. Desired inter-vehicle angle (degrees x 100), 4. Last time in ms we received a msg from the neighbor
The size of the array is the maximum number of possible neighbors. Errors w.r.t. desired inter-vehicle angles (degrees x 100)

message.name: RLFILTER
message.description: Relative localization data for other tracked MAVs in terms of x y and z in the body axis

message.name: GVF
message.description: Information about the trajectory followed by the Guidance Vector Field algorithm.
message.field: Error index e, i.e. 'distance' to the trajectory
Gain for the vector field convergence

message.name: JEVOIS
message.description: Debug message for the JeVois smart camera corresponding to the standardized messages
message.field: Text string describing the reported object
Number of elements in the coordinates array
List of coordinates corresponding to 1D, 2D or 3D messages
Quaternion that relates the object's frame to the camera's frame, if appropriate

message.name: WIND_INFO_RET
message.description: Wind information returned to the ground station. The wind is reported as a vector, it gives the direction the wind is blowing to. This can be used to acknowledge data comming from the ground wind estimator or from an embedded algorithm. Flags field definition: - bit 0: horizontal wind is valid (east and north fields) - bit 1: vertical wind is valid (up field) - bit 2: airspeed is valid
message.field: bit 0: horizontal wind, bit 1: vertical wind: bit 2: airspeed

message.name: VISION_POSITION_ESTIMATE
message.description: Generic message to send position measurement from computer vision
message.field: In case the default message does not suit you

message.name: LOGGER_STATUS
message.description: Logger status and error id (dependent of the logging system)
message.field: Error number, depend of the logging system, provides detailed information
Accumulated number of bytes written by the logger

message.name: CAMERA_PAYLOAD
message.field: Percentage of used memory (RAM) of the payload computer rounded up to whole percent
Percentage of used disk of the payload computer rounded up to whole percent

message.name: COPILOT_STATUS
message.field: Percentage of used memory (RAM) of the mission computer rounded up to whole percent
Percentage of used disk of the mission computer rounded up to whole percent
Error codes of the mission computer

message.name: CAMERA_SNAPSHOT
message.field: Unique camera ID - consists of make,model and camera index
Flag checking whether the last snapshot was valid
Lens temperature, NaN if not measured
Imager sensor temperature, NaN if not measured

message.name: RATE_LOOP
message.description: Rotorcraft rate control loop.

message.name: INS_EKF2
message.description: Extended Kalman Filter 2 status message which gives feedback about the input- and output states of the filter.
message.field: description of the control status (bitfields from common.h)
numerical errors in output states (bitfields from common.h)
quality check of the GPS feedback (bitfields from common.h)
which output states are valid or has an error (bitfields from common.h)
which inputs exceed the innovation test

message.name: AEROPROBE
message.description: Airflow data returned by OTF and uADC 3D probes from Aeroprobe.

message.name: ROTORCRAFT_FP_MIN
message.description: Minimalistic message to track Rotorcraft over very low bandwidth links

message.name: AIR_DATA
message.field: barometric pressure adjusted to sea level
barometric altitude above mean sea level
Equivalent Air Speed (or Calibrated Air Speed at low speed/altitude)
True Air Speed (when P, T and P_diff are available)

message.name: DIVERGENCE
message.field: covariance of divergence and thrust, or past divergence depending on the mode (-)
gain state in adaptive gain control: indicative of height (-)
gain used for control, includes the effect of the p-gain of adaptive control (-)

message.name: TIME
message.field: an integral value representing the number of seconds elapsed since 00:00 hours, Jan 1, 1970 UTC

message.name: ROVER_STATUS
message.description: Rover status message
message.field: Rover AP modes are generated from XML file

message.name: VISUALTARGET
message.description: Generic message with pixel coordinates of detected targets
message.field: In case many detectors run, which one did find this target

message.name: KEY_EXCHANGE_UAV
message.description: Message for key exchange during crypto initialization

message.name: OPTICAL_FLOW_HOVER
message.description: This messages includes the messages send by the Optical Flow Hover module, providing data for all three axes.
message.field: Filtered Horizontal velocity in X / height used in Optical Flow Hover
Filtered Horizontal velocity in X / height used in Optical Flow Hover
Filtered vertical velocity / height used in Optical Flow Hover
covariance of Ventral flow in X and past ventral flow in X
covariance of Ventral flow in Y and past ventral flow in Y
covariance of divergence and past divergence or thrust history
Gain used in the X feedback
Gain used in the Y feedback
Gain used in the Z feedback
The desired phi angle in degrees
The desired theta angle in degrees

message.name: ESC
message.description: Electronic Speed Controller data

message.name: RTOS_MON
message.description: RTOS monitoring
message.field: Total fragmented free memory in the heap
Number of fragments in the heap
Largest free block in the heap

message.name: BATTERY_MONITOR
message.field: Cell bank 1 monitor i2c transaction status
Cell bank 2 monitor i2c transaction status

message.name: GPS_SMALL
message.field: bits 31-21 course in decideg : bits 20-10 ground speed in cm/s : bits 9-0 climb speed in cm/s

message.name: DCF_THETA
message.description: Air-to-air message for the Distributed Circular Formation algorithm. It transmits the ac's theta to its neighbor

message.name: SECURE_LINK_STATUS
message.description: Message for monitoring key exchange status

message.name: WIND_INFO
message.description: Wind information. The wind is reported as a vector, it gives the direction the wind is blowing to. This can be comming from the ground wind estimator or from an embedded algorithm. Flags field definition: - bit 0: horizontal wind is valid (east and north fields) - bit 1: vertical wind is valid (up field) - bit 2: airspeed is valid
message.field: bit 0: horizontal wind, bit 1: vertical wind: bit 2: airspeed

message.name: JOYSTICK_RAW
message.description: This message is used to send joystick input that can be used in any mode for control of the vehicle or the payload depending of the 'joystick_handler' function implementation. The scale of the inputs should be between -PPRZ_MAX (or 0) and PPRZ_MAX.

message.name: DESIRED_SETPOINT
message.description: This message is used to set 3D desired vehicle's states such as accelerations or velocities. The 'flag' field can be used at the user convenience to provide indication about the type of value to track (like position, speed, acceleration, ...) or the reference frame (ENU / NED, LTP / body frame, ...)
message.field: Up to the user, for example to distinguish between ENU or NED
Quantity to be tracked in the X axis
Quantity to be tracked in the Y axis
Quantity to be tracked in the Z axis

message.name: MISSION_CUSTOM
message.description: Custom navigation pattern or action for mission controller. This will add the mission element correspond to the string identifier 'type' if it has been registered.
message.field: Mission element index, should be unique
String identifier of the custom pattern
Duration of the element or -1 for unlimited

message.name: COPILOT_STATUS_DL
message.field: Percentage of used memory (RAM) of the mission computer rounded up to whole percent
Percentage of used disk of the mission computer rounded up to whole percent
Error codes of the mission computer

message.name: CAMERA_PAYLOAD_DL
message.field: Percentage of used memory (RAM) of the payload computer rounded up to whole percent
Percentage of used disk of the payload computer rounded up to whole percent

message.name: CAMERA_SNAPSHOT_DL
message.field: Unique camera ID - consists of make,model and camera index
Flag checking whether the last snapshot was valid
Imager sensor temperature, NaN if not measured
Lens temperature, NaN if not measured

message.name: GUIDED_SETPOINT_NED
message.description: Set vehicle position or velocity in NED. Frame can be specified with the bits 0-3 Velocity of position setpoint can be specified with the bits 5-7 Flags field definition: - bit 0: x,y as offset coordinates - bit 1: x,y in body coordinates - bit 2: z as offset coordinates - bit 3: yaw as offset coordinates - bit 4: free - bit 5: x,y as vel - bit 6: z as vel - bit 7: yaw as rate
message.field: bits 0-3: frame, bits 5-7: use as velocity

message.name: REMOTE_GPS_SMALL
message.field: bits 31-21 east position [cm] : bits 20-10 north position [cm] : bits 9-0 up position [cm]
bits 31-21 east speed [cm/s] : bits 20-10 north speed [cm/s] : bits 9-0 climb speed [cm/s]

message.name: REMOTE_GPS_LOCAL
message.description: Position and speed in local frame from a remote GPS or motion capture system Global position transformations are handled onboard if needed

message.name: TARGET_POS
message.description: Global position, speed and ID a target for functions like Follow Me

message.name: VIDEO_ROI
message.field: The aircraft in which video stream you clicked
The x of the upper left corner of the selected area
The y of the upper left corner of the selected area
The width of the selected area
The height of the selected area
The width of the image you received. Added because a module the receives this message does not know how big the image was that was broadcasted

message.name: EMERGENCY_CMD
message.description: Overcome setting ID and block ID problems in the case of multiboard autopilots like AP/FBW. With this message a KILL command can be sent to AP and FBW at the same time.

message.name: DCF_REG_TABLE
message.description: Init the table of an aircraft for the Distributed Circular Formation algorithm. If the nei_id is equal to zero, then you wipe out (clean) the whole table of the aircraft.
message.field: ID of the table's aircraft to be updated
ID of the neighbor for the table
Desired angle to have w.r.t. the neighbor

message.name: KEY_EXCHANGE_GCS
message.description: Message for key exchange during crypto initialization
message.field: ID of the table's aircraft to be updated

message.name: TELEMETRY_STATUS
message.description: Datalink status reported by Server for the GCS Combines DATLINK_REPORT (telemetry class) and LINK_REPORT (ground class)

message.name: TELEMETRY_ERROR
message.description: Report a telemetry error

message.name: TELEMETRY_MESSAGE
message.description: Encapsulated a telemetry class message (when using redundant link)

message.name: DATALINK_MESSAGE
message.description: Encapsulated a datalink class message (when using redundant link)

message.name: LINK_REPORT
message.description: Datalink status reported by Link for the Server

message.name: SHAPE
message.description:
The SHAPE message used to draw shapes onto the Paparazzi GCS. Field name shape is used to define the type of shape i.e. Circle, Polygon, Line, or Text. This is indexed from 0-3 respectively.
Each shape drawn must have an id number associated with it. This id number in conjuction with the shapetype will be needed to update or delete the shape. A circle can be defined with the same id as a polygon but since they have different shape types they are considered unique.
linecolor and fillcolor take in a color string ie: "red", "blue"
opacity will change the level of transparency of the fill. 0 - Transparent 1 - Light Fill 2 - Medium Fill 3 - Opaque
Passing a status of 0 will create or update the shape specified by id and type. Passing a status of 1 will delete the shape specified by id and type.
latarr is an array of coordinates that contain the latitude coordinate for each point in the shape. The array is comma separated. lonarr is similar to latarr but contain the longitude coordinate for each point in the shape.
Circle and Text type will take the first coordinates given to place the shape. Polygon will take all the coordinates given. Line will take the first two coordinates given.
Radius is only used for the circle.
Text will always be populated with each message using the first set of coordinates. The text field can not be blank or have spaces. If text is not desired for a shape then pass "NULL" into the text field.

message.name: GROUND_REF
message.description: Ground reference provided by an external positioning system for instance
message.field: speed in selected frame (LTP_NED in case of LLA frame)
Unitary quaternion representing LTP to BODY orientation (qi, qx, qy, qz)

message.name: JOYSTICK
message.description: Generic 4 axis and 4 buttons joystick or joypad. This message can be provided by the 'input2ivy' tool for other ground agents. Standard joystick axis values are on 16 bits signed integers, but tools like 'input2ivy' may scale them on int8 type.

message.name: STEREOCAM_ARRAY
message.description: Raw data fromt the stereocamera. Type defines what kind of data it is. This can be raw image, disparity map, obstacle histogram, ect.
message.field: If the data being sent is too large for one message (e.g when sending a full image) this will indicate which package of the total data is contained in this message

message.name: STEREOCAM_VELOCITY
message.description: Velocity measured using optical flow and stereovision. All parameters are in the camera frame
message.field: Resolution of the vel and pos messages
Time difference to previous message, not strictly required
Distance traveled since the last message

message.name: STEREOCAM_STATE
message.description: Estimated state of the camera. As the stereocamera has no inertial sensors, this data should be sent to the stereocamera to enable onboard derotation of the optical flow
message.field: Pitch, roll and yaw angles of the camera
Altitude above the ground. If not looking down, set to 0

message.name: IMCU_DATALINK
message.description: Forward FBW datalink to AP

message.name: IMCU_TELEMETRY
message.description: Forward AP telemetry to FBW
